page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY, CHITTERNE
page.content: The Wallis family has farmed at "The Manor", Chitterne for over 2OO years. A horse chestnut tree was planted on the village green to commemerate Queen Victoria's Jubilee in 1887 and is still there. Other trees were planted in 1953 to celebrate the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. St. Mary's Church fell into disrepair and was pulled down, leaving only the Chancel. The tiles in the Chancel of All Saint's Church, which was completed in 1862, are from St. Mary's, and so are some of the furnishings. Mr. Collins of Manor Farm, Codford, has a collection of old farm tools and equipment, open to the public on request. Quebec Farm was named after the Battle for Quebec in 1759, and built in that year, although ther original buildings no longer stand.
